page.title: 05WOODLAND VEGETATION
page.content: There is irregular spacing between trees and enormous old trees which would have been cut long ago in a commercial wood. The coppice woodland is mainly associated with poor quality acid soils(pH 5-6) based on terraced gravels. The area is immediately south-east of the River Stour. At the time of the survey many plants could be seen including anenomies, primroses and red campion. Vast numbers of insects such as butterflies and beetles could also be observed, especially in Trenleypark wood. The amount of land used for coppicing has significantly declined in recent years. In the area surveyed, the demand for timber has been reduced to the extent that 17% of the land is being converted to agricultural use.
